title: The Waters Recede
summary: Genesis 8 details how the floodwaters gradually receded. Noah sends out birds to check for dry land. When the ground dries, Noah leaves the ark and offers a sacrifice. God promises never to flood the earth again.

faq.question: What was the first thing Noah did after leaving the ark?
faq.answer: He built an altar and offered a sacrifice to God.

faq.question: What did God promise afterward?
faq.answer: God promised never to destroy the earth by flood again and blessed the cycle of seasons.

faq.question: Why did Noah build an altar after the flood?
faq.answer: Building an altar and offering a sacrifice was a common way to say thank you to God or ask for blessing. It showed respect and gratitude for surviving something dangerous.

faq.question: Why did God give new rules about eating animals?
faq.answer: Before this, people likely only ate plants. Now, after the flood, God allowed them to eat animals but told them to treat life with respect, especially by not eating blood, which represented life.
